p: By 5 March 2020, the viral spread increased, and all 31 provinces were affected. Then, by 3 April the number of confirmed cases reached 53,183 with deaths 3294 in Iran. The government prohibited many activities: Sale and export of face masks to legal entities were limited, commercial movements with China were prevented, and travel was banned. Cancelation of all public gatherings, including cinemas, concerts, theaters, postponement of weddings, parties, conferences, seminars, camps and collective sports, school closure, and establishing E- learning, reduced office hours for 2 h/day [ 45]. People were guided for hand-washing and wearing masks. Suspected and infected people with COVID-19 were isolated for 14 days [ 46].
